circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Lucy Schuhmann was reported missing on Thursday, September 19, 2019, after she did not return to her vacation rental in the Coral Bay area on St. John, VI. Her rental vehicle was located on Friday, September 20, 2019 in the Salt Pond area of the Virgin Islands National Park. A backpack belonging to Schuhmann was located near the edge of a cliff at the top of Ram Head Trail inside the park.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Mrs. Laplace left home around 9pm on May 1, 1974. She got into her car and drove a little bit down the road from her house. The car was found with no purse or keys and no evidence of foul play. The missing persons report was destroyed in a fire/flood since.

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance:
On August 11, 2000, Dr. David D. Voss left Arkansas for a week long vacation, traveling to St. Croix, in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
He checked into his hotel late in the evening on Friday, August 11, 2000.  He sent emails back to Arkansas on Saturday, 8-12-2000, saying he had arrived safely and was going scuba-diving after sending the emails.  He rented diving equipment from a local shop and returned the equipment later that day.  On Sunday, August 13th, he again rented diving equipment for the rest of the week with the agreement to return the equipment prior to his return flight back to the states on August 18, 2000.  He has never been seen or heard from since Sunday, August 13, 2000.  The diving equipment was never returned.  All of his personal belongings, including credit cards, wallet, cash, and airline ticket was found in his hotel room.  The rental Jeep was still parked in the hotel parking lot.  He was not reported as missing until Saturday, August 19 when he failed to return to Clarksville, AR.  The last known contact of any kind was on Sunday, August 13th.  Upon the Missing Person's Report being filed, local authorities, along with Coast Guard personnel conducted a search of local waters and beach area surrounding the hotel.  Nothing was ever found.

notes.description: Anyone with information should call the V.I. Police Department at 778-2211 or the following numbers in Arkansas: 501-754-7678, 501

clothingAndAccessoriesArticles.description: He took some diving equipment from home (AR)- we have an inventory list.
Standard tropical island attire - mesh tank tops - shorts - bright green flourescent diving suit.
Large-face, water-resistant, divers' wrist watch, solid gold wedding band.

physicalFeatureDescriptions.description: Left ear pieced, though diamond-stud earring was not always worn.

Police on St. Thomas are asking for the community’s assistance to locate a missing 51-year-old man.  Clayton Antonio Simmonds, also known as “Tony or Shaku,” was last seen by his family more than 10 years ago. Police have been searching for anyone who may have seen Simmonds lately without success.

publicGeolocation.formattedAddress: Fort Mylner Shopping Center, Charlotte Amalie, VI 00802, United States

circumstances.circumstancesOfDisappearance: Hannah Upp was last seen the morning of Thursday, September 14, 2017, leaving her home in the East End  (Pillsbury Heights) )  of the island of Saint Thomas in the US Virgin Islands.  It was in between Hurricane Irma and Maria.  Her car was found on Sunday, September 17, at Sapphire Beach.  In her car was all of her Identification, credit cards, passport, phone, money, all her valuables and all that would identify her was left behind.  Her keys and sandals and sarong had been found down by the beach.  A report was filed with Police, USVIPD, and extensive searching was done on Sunday, Sept. 17 and Monday Sept. 18, until the forces and vessels had to stand down because of the approach of Hurricane Maria.  There have been many efforts by friends and by Search and Rescue Teams to locate Hannah, but she has not been found as of June 7, 2018.
